line_1: Three times he drops, three times he lifts his plaid,
line_2: Hope and despair by turns his breast invade:

line_1: In all the honours of our ravish'd Plaid,

line_1: Yet, as when little, round his Knees She plaid;
line_2: He call'd her oft, in Sport, His Nut-brown Maid:

line_1: Her Lute well in tune too, cou'd he but have plaid;
line_2: Her Face like an Angel, Fair, Plump, and a Maid,

line_1: Then first the Muses sung; melodious Strains Apollo plaid,
line_2: And Musick first begun by thy auspicious Aid.
